questions.question_text: Which step is the first for web-based single sign-on login?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Fig 1 Step 1 - A browser-based client attempts to access a protected resource on a service provider.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/SAML_SSO_deployment_guide/12_5_1/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-12_5/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-12_5_chapter_01.html#CUCM_RF_S4D8F901_00

On page 3, 
The complete authentication and authorization flow has been simplified as:
â€¢ When you access an application with protected resources, the application will redirect you to the Cisco IdentityService for authentication. Cisco IdentityService leveragesSAML and generates aSAMLRequest and redirects the browser to the Identity Provider.

choices.B: Redirect to IdP to get authenticated.

choices.D: In the Presence Redundancy Group Configuration > Cisco Unified Communications Manager, check the Enable Automatic Fallback parameter.
choices.A: In IM and Presence Service Parameter Configuration > Cisco Server Recovery Manager, change the Failover parameter to True.
choices.C: Automatic fallback is enabled by default.
choices.B: In Communications Manager Service Parameter Configuration > Cisco Server Recovery Manager, change the Enable Automatic Fallback parameter to True.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I change my answer to B as it is not enable HA but automatic fallback

Selected Answer: D
Cisco Unified CM Administration, choose System > Presence Redundancy Groups.
 Check the Enable High Availability check box to enable high availability for the presence redundancy group.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/11_5_1/cup0_b_config-and-admin-guide-1151su5/cup0_b_imp-system-configuration-1151su5_chapter_0100.html#CUCM_TK_E75FE600_00

Selected Answer: B
Automatic fallback is not the default configuration, but it can be enabled. To enable automatic fallback, change the Enable Automatic Fallback parameter in the Server Recovery Manager Service Parameters to value True.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/SAML_SSO_deployment_guide/12_5_1/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-12_5/cucm_b_saml-sso-deployment-guide-12_5_chapter_01.html#CUCM_RF_S4D8F901_00

Selected Answer: B
Check: Configure Heartbeat Interval for Failover 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/11_5_1/cup0_b_config-and-admin-guide-1151su5/cup0_b_imp-system-configuration-1151su5_chapter_0100.html

Selected Answer: A
B correct. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-im-presence-service/200958-IM-and-Presence-Server-High-Availability.html#anc52

comments.content: did you pass recently with this dump?

discussion.content: A is the correct answer, under IMP service parameter, Server recovery Manager, you can change the enable automatic fallback

Selected Answer: B
This question is designed to trip you up...AnswerB is correct but it makes you feel like you are applying the service parameter change to a CUCM node when you are not, ie you are applying it to an IMP node. Clearly, the Server recover Manager service is only accessible once you have selected an IMP node from the list of servers...You can then select Cisco Server recovery Manager>Enable Automatic Fallback = True.

questions.question_text: How is automatic fallback enabled on a Cisco IM and Presence server?
Which description of an IdP server is true?

discussion.content: A is the correct

Selected Answer: A
Should be A

A
IdP server: This entity authenticates user credentials and issues SAML assertions.

SAML assertion: This element consists of pieces of security information that are transferred from IdPs to the service provider for user authentication. An assertion is an XML document that contains trusted statements about a subject including a username and privileges. SAML assertions are usually digitally signed to ensure their authenticity.

A
Identity Provider is an online service or website that authenticates users by means of security tokens. It authenticates the end user and returns a SAML Assertion. SAML Assertion shows either a Yes (authenticated) or No (authentication failed) response.
Reference : https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/connection/11x/quick_start/guide/b_11xcucqssamlsso.html
A is the correct answer.
should be A
A. authenticates user credentials

choices.D: consists of pieces of security information that are transferred to the service provider for user authentication
choices.C: is an authentication request that is generated by a Cisco Unified Communications application

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

A customer reports that after a network failure, all of the Cisco Jabber clients are not switched back to their home nodes. An engineer determines that the primary
Cisco IM&P server is in Failed Over state. Which two actions should be performed to bring the system back to operational state and to prevent future occurrences? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
(D) failover is a valid option
(E) because of chapter: Configure Heartbeat Interval for Failover

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/11_5_1/cup0_b_config-and-admin-guide-1151su5/cup0_b_imp-system-configuration-1151su5_chapter_0100.html

Selected Answer: DE
D is for manaul operational. and E is set auto back
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-im-presence-service/200958-IM-and-Presence-Server-High-Availability.html
Correct Answer is C, D

choices.B: Confirm that both IM&P servers are configured in the Presence Redundancy Group configuration pane.
choices.C: Perform a restart of the IM&P primary server to force fallback.
choices.E: Set the Automatic Failover parameter in the Server Recovery Manager Service Parameters to the value True.
choices.D: Click the Fallback button in the Server Action pane.
choices.A: Advise all users to re-login to their Jabber clients.
